thread.title: Cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati turns controversial | Deccan Chronicle
thread.title_full: Cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati turns controversial | Deccan Chronicle

author: DC
title: Cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati turns controversial | Deccan Chronicle
text:
DC CORRESPONDENT | October 21, 2015, 15.47 pm Cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati (Photo: Facebook) Guntur : A team started cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati on October 19, in support of the TD rule of 502 days on the occasion of the foundation ceremony of the capital.
The cycle rally turned controversial after telecasting a video footage by a Telugu TV channel showing that some of the members of the team were loading their cycles on a truck after crossing a village and boarding a bus. The team known as Bring Babu Back organised the rally.
J. Venkat, coordinator of the Bring Babu Back team accepted that some of the members who fell sick during the rally and others, whose cycle was damaged boarded a bus and their cycles were loaded on a truck.
He said that they also arranged an ambulance along with them for first aid treatment.
States: Andhra Pradesh Amaravati Hyderabad Andhra Pradesh South Soil and water from 16,000 villages sprinkled over Amaravati Loading... Please Wait 1/16 Soil and water which was brought from villages across state was sprinkled from a helicopter all over Amaravati by Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu on Wednesday. The foundation stone laying ceremony will take place on October 22. (Photo: Twitter) 2/16 Nearly 20,000 water and soil pitchers from 16,000 villages and 4,000 wards of the AP have been received, apart from contributions from elsewhere. 3/16 Religious prayers were held to give sanctity to the water and soil by priests of Hindu, Muslim, Christian and Buddhist communities. (Photo: Twitter) 4/16 Naidu said that this is peopleâ€™s capital hence it is located on the banks of Krishna River which distance is equal to various areas of the AP and reachable to every one from 13 districts. (Deccan Chronicle) 5/16 Workers making Chakkera Pongali and Pulihora for people at Uddandarayuni palem in Amaravati. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 6/16 Police in large numbers have been deployed at the venue and nearby areas to provide security to the arriving guests. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 7/16 A huge cut out of Chandrababu Naidu and Narendra Modi was prepared to welcome both the dignitaries for the Foundation ceremony. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 8/16 A cycle rally from Hyderabad to Amaravati was organised on October 19, in support of the TD rule of 502 days on the occasion of the Foundation ceremony of the capital. (Photo: Deccan Chronicle) 9/16 Elaborate arrangements are being made in Guntur district for the foundation stone laying ceremony. 10/16 Workers are giving finishing touches to the VIP dais and Amaravthi Sankalpa Jyothi Platform. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will lay the foundation stone for the capital city. 11/16 Barricading works in progress at the ceremony venue. Chandrababu Naidu also extended an invitation to K Chandrasekhar Rao to attend the ceremony which the Telangana Chief Minister gracefully accepted. 12/16 Adilakshmi the first women who gave farm land under LPS receiving silk clothes and invitatation for foundation ceremony from ministers P.Pulla Rao, P.Narayana, Vijayawada MP K. Nani. 13/16 Guntur Collector Kantilal Dande along with Guntur Range IG N. Sanjay inspecting the works of Amaravthi Sankalpa Jyothi Platform. 14/16 The arrangements at the venue include three daises, which will host the Prime Minister flanked by the two VVIPs. 15/16 Different sections of people and government departments including police and advocates collected water and soil from various divisions in Kakinada for construction of capital. 16/16 Members of the Muslim community from various localities of Guntur and Krishna districts also gathered at the venue praying for smooth conduct of the function on October 22.
